main event: On February 7, 1957, a lighted, cigar-shaped object was observed in the sky over Kittery Point, Maine, and East Nassau, New York, exhibiting erratic movement patterns including acceleration and hovering before disappearing after approximately 30 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as cigar-shaped and emitted light as it moved.
Witnesses observed erratic flight patterns, including sudden accelerations and periods of hovering.
The object was in sight for around 30 minutes before disappearing.
Reported sightings from two different locations, Kittery Point, Maine, and East Nassau, New York, add credibility to the event.
The case is supported by two photographs of the object or structure, adding visual evidence to the report.
location: Kittery Point, ME and East Nassau, NY
photographs: yes, the report includes two photographs
